articles.title: NVIDIA Drives Performance Gap Between AI Funds
articles.summary: The article analyzes the performance gap between two major AI-focused ETFs, Global X Robotics & Artificial Intelligence ETF (BOTZ) and Global Robotics & Automation Index ETF (ROBO). It highlights how BOTZ's significant outperformance is largely attributed to its heavy weighting in NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA), which has seen exceptional growth. The comparison provides insights for investors considering different approaches to AI sector investments, acknowledging NVIDIA's dominance while also pointing out the risks associated with such a concentrated bet.

articles.title: HIVE Rebrands, Announces Expansion Into Cloud Computing Services
articles.summary: HIVE Digital Technologies Ltd., formerly HIVE Blockchain, has rebranded and announced its expansion into cloud computing services, utilizing its 38,000 Nvidia GPUs. The company plans to launch "HIVE Cloud" to offer rental services for GPU server clusters, aiming to tap into the high demand for AI-driven computational power. While expanding into a potentially high-margin business, HIVE will also continue its existing bitcoin mining operations.

articles.title: Semiconductor Stocks Are Hot -- So Is Their Long-Term Outlook
articles.summary: Semiconductor stocks and related ETFs, like the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH), have experienced significant growth this year, driven largely by enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, particularly due to companies like Nvidia. While concerns about valuation exist, analysts believe the long-term outlook remains attractive, bolstered by a rebounding PC and smartphone market, and the massive potential of AI development across industries.

articles.title: Fortinet’s stock nabs record closing high, while Microsoft, Nvidia, Broadcom bids all fall short
articles.summary: On Friday, July 14, 2023, several AI-related stocks, including Microsoft, Nvidia, and Broadcom, aimed for record closing highs, but only Fortinet succeeded. Nvidia and Broadcom shares initially rose following positive analyst feedback on their AI chip market potential but ultimately closed down. This illustrates the fluctuating nature of the tech rally driven by artificial intelligence.

articles.title: A breakdown of the changes to the Nasdaq-100 and what it means for mega-cap tech stocks
articles.summary: Nasdaq announced a special rebalance of the Nasdaq-100 Index to dilute the weightings of mega-cap tech stocks that have outperformed in 2023. The seven largest stocks in the Nasdaq-100 will see their combined weighting reduced from 56% to 44%, with Nvidia and Microsoft being most affected. Historically, similar rebalances have not had a significant impact on stock prices.

articles.title: HIVE Blockchain Rebrands, Leveraging The Breakthrough Of AI
articles.summary: HIVE Blockchain Technologies is rebranding to HIVE Digital Technologies to reflect its expansion into AI-focused HPC data centers. The company will leverage its green energy data centers and GPU Cloud computing technology for AI and machine learning applications. This strategic move aims to bridge the gap between blockchain and traditional capital markets, while the company's trading symbols and share structure remain unchanged.

articles.title: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. – More market share gains expected
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is expected to gain further market share in the data center CPU market and capitalize on opportunities to expand its presence in the data center GPU market due to increased generative AI adoption. The company's margins are projected to grow post-acquisition of Xilinx and Pensando, driven by increasing revenue contributions from its Data Centre and Embedded segments. Phillip Securities Research initiates coverage with an Accumulate recommendation and a target price of US$125.00, anticipating marginal revenue growth in FY23e and re-acceleration in FY24e.

articles.title: Growth-Stock Funds Fly High but Fall Short in 2023′s First Half
articles.summary: Growth-stock funds experienced a strong rebound in the first half of 2023 after significant losses in 2022, with large-growth funds doubling small-growth funds' gains. However, two-thirds of U.S.-centric active managers underperformed stylistically relevant indexes and passive rivals due to untimely sector allocations and light stakes in mega-cap stocks that drove market performance. International and emerging markets showed more modest gains, with some regions outperforming others, leading to a mixed bag for global stocks.

articles.title: Aehr Reports Record Revenue and Profit for Fiscal 2023 and Guides for Over 50% Increase in Revenue for Fiscal 2024 on Strength from Semiconductor Wafer Level Test and Burn-in Demand
articles.summary: Aehr Test Systems announced record financial results for fiscal 2023, with net sales reaching $65.0 million and GAAP net income of $14.6 million, driven by demand for semiconductor wafer level test and burn-in products. The company also provided strong guidance for fiscal 2024, projecting revenue of at least $100 million, a 50% increase, and GAAP net income of at least $28 million, reflecting over 90% growth. This growth is attributed to increased adoption of their FOX systems and WaferPak Contactors for silicon carbide in electric vehicles, as well as new opportunities in silicon photonics and gallium nitride markets.
